definition: to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable
(of a title, degree etc) illegitimately conferred
pinyin: ming2 bu5 zheng4 yan2 bu5 shun4

definition: see 桀驁不馴|桀骜不驯[jie2 ao4 bu4 xun4]

sentences.english: When you are … living in disobedience …
People have emotions, feelings did not ring true To reach the grief of Health.
sentences.chinese: 人有七情六欲，情不顺欲不达则悲生。

sentences.english: Difficulty during urination, or feel pain or burns.
sentences.chinese: 排尿不顺或感觉疼痛或有灼热感。

sentences.english: You can't call Jesus your Lord when you refuse to obey him.
sentences.chinese: 你若不顺服他就不能称耶稣为主。

sentences.english: More appropriate would be "I'm going through a rough patch now.
sentences.chinese: 更合适的回应是“我正经历不顺。

sentences.english: Indeed, anything untoward was now kept from James.
sentences.chinese: 的确，现在一切不顺心的事都小心瞒著詹姆士。

sentences.english: I'm feeling rather frustrated in my present job; I need a change.
sentences.chinese: 我感到现在做得很不顺心，需要换一换工作。

sentences.english: Don"t take your frustration out on me."
sentences.chinese: 别因为今天你不顺就拿我撒气。

sentences.english: Do not ring true meaning of life a lot.
sentences.chinese: 生活中不顺意的事一大堆。

sentences.english: Call up momma when all else fails?
sentences.chinese: 当一切不顺心时你会打电话给妈妈吗？

sentences.english: We often remarked that there are much violence and cruelness in our society, so weather goes bad.
sentences.chinese: 我们常说现在社会暴戾之气太重，因此气候也不顺。

sentences.english: As the Greek ships gathered at the port of Aulis, no favouring wind blew up.
sentences.chinese: 当希腊舰队停驻在奥利斯海港时，风向一直不顺。

sentences.english: You do it without delay. Every parent knows that delayed obedience is really disobedience.
sentences.chinese: 每一位作父母都知道，延迟的顺服就是不顺服。

sentences.english: 48He saw the disciples straining at the oars, because the wind was against them.
sentences.chinese: 看见门徒因风不顺，摇橹甚苦。

sentences.english: Maybe they don't see eye to eye.
sentences.chinese: 也许它们彼此看不顺眼。

sentences.english: Emotive fails, of the job not satisfactory.
sentences.chinese: 感情的失败，工作的不顺心。

definition: everything is going smoothly/just as one wishes
the year's horoscope augurs ill (idiom); an unlucky year
to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable
propitious wind throughout the journey (idiom)/plain sailing/to go smoothly/have a nice trip!
(of an illness, debt etc) to plague sb/to preoccupy sb/difficult to get rid of
as one wants/according to one's wishes/ruyi scepter, a symbol of power and good fortune
